byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: Many analysts say British Prime Min David Cameron's commitment to hold in-or-out referendum on continued European Union membership could badly damage Britain's economy along with his political future; believe decision was badly judged and Cameron will be pushed out whether or not Britain remains in bloc.
lead_paragraph: The British leader promised an in-or-out referendum on the European Union to solve a short-term political problem. The consequences could be enormous.

headline.main: In ‘Brexit’ Vote, David Cameron Faces Problem of His Own Making
headline.print_headline: ‘Brexit,’ Cameron’s Problem of His Own Making

snippet: The British leader promised an in-or-out referendum on the European Union to solve a short-term political problem. The consequences could be enormous.
